intro: Hieracium leptobrachium, commonly known as the slender-stemmed hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium leptobrachium is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
